Optimal discounting: $s_{0\rightarrow T}\sim \sum_{t=0}^T w_t \cdot s_t$
where $\{w_t\}_{t=0}^T$ is determined by an optimization problem

$$
\begin{aligned}
&\max_{\mathcal{W}}\;&&\sum_{t=0}^T w_tu(s_t) - C(\mathcal{W}) \\
&s.t.\; &&\sum_{t=0}^Tw_t =A \\
&&& w_t >0 \text{ for all } t\in \{0,1,...,T\}
\end{aligned}
$$

with separable information cost function

$$
C(\mathcal{W})=\sum_{t=0}^Tf_t(w_t)
$$

where $f_t(.)$ is twice differentiable, $f_t'(.)>0$, $f_t''(.)>0$.

Axiom 1 $\succsim$ is complete, transitive, continuous and
state-independent.

(state independence) $s_t \succsim s'_t$ implies that for any
$\alpha \in (0,1)$ and reward $c$,
$\alpha \cdot s_t + (1-\alpha)\cdot c \succsim \alpha \cdot s'_t + (1-\alpha)\cdot c$.

$s_{0\rightarrow T} \sim \sum_{t=0}^T w_t\cdot s_t$ and

$\sum_{t=0}^T w_tu(s_t) \geq \sum_{t=0}^{T'} w'_tu(s'_t)$.
